item.title: Pentagon’s New Defense Strategy Strikes Conciliatory Tone on China
item.description: The blueprint says the U.S. will focus attention on the Western Hemisphere while reducing its military role in Europe, South Korea and the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Michael R. Gordon

item.title: China Built a Vast Oil Stake in Venezuela. Now It Risks Getting Muscled Out.
item.description: Beijing’s moves bought it sway in Venezuela—all of it now subject to the Trump administration’s preferences in the wake of Maduro’s ouster.
item.dc:creator: James T. Areddy

item.title: Syrian President Called the U.S.’s Bluff—and It Paid Off
item.description: His unexpected offensive in northeast Syria claimed huge territory for Damascus and fractured a U.S.-backed militia.
item.dc:creator: Lara Seligman

item.title: Europe Prepares for a Nightmare Scenario: The U.S. Blocking Access to Tech
item.description: Trump’s threats have injected new urgency into European efforts to reduce its reliance on American technology.
item.dc:creator: Kim Mackrael

item.title: Treasury Rate Check Boosts Yen, Weakens Dollar
item.description: U.S. and Japanese authorities are increasingly worried about the yen, and could be signaling intervention is around the corner.
item.dc:creator: Jason Douglas

item.title: With the Fate of Greenland in Flux, It’s Back to the Age of Empire
item.description: The White House is reviving a game of territorial expansion that treats foreign lands as real estate and their people as Americans-in-waiting.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Walker

item.title: Trump Administration Pushes Out Key Officials Focused on China Tech Threat
item.description: The departing staffers worked for a Commerce Department office charged with protecting the U.S. from Chinese technological advances.

item.title: Trump Comments on Afghan-War Veterans Spark Backlash From Allies
item.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer called the president’s remarks “insulting and frankly appalling.”

item.title: Opinion | A Serious Defense Budget, at Last
item.description: A $1.5 trillion military will cost much less than a war with China.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Opinion | The Best Speech in Europe This Week
item.description: Speaker Johnson told the British Parliament about our common values crucial to Western renewal.
item.dc:creator: The Editorial Board

item.title: Team Trump Is Livid After Canada’s Carney Calls Out U.S. Coercion
item.description: Washington and Ottawa are quarreling after the prime minister signaled smaller countries needed to fight back against perceived U.S. bullying.
item.dc:creator: Paul Vieira

item.title: Opinion | What Trump Knows About Greenland
item.description: It might not fill a textbook but it shows why the contest isn’t over and will likely embroil U.S. rivals.
item.dc:creator: Holman W. Jenkins, Jr.

item.title: Former Olympic Snowboarder Turned Suspected Drug Trafficker Surrenders in Mexico
item.description: Ryan Wedding is accused of being associated with the Sinaloa Cartel and was on the FBI’s 10 most wanted list.
item.dc:creator: Santiago Pérez

item.title: Opinion | Zelensky and Trump Expose Europe’s Weakness
item.description: ‘Europe loves to discuss the future,’ the Ukrainian told the Davos crowd, ‘but avoids taking action today.’

item.title: Crackdown on Shadow Fleet Escalates With Seizure of Ship Carrying Russian Oil
item.description: French forces’ boarding of a tanker signaled a more aggressive approach to sanctioned ships that move the oil fueling Russia’s war economy.
item.dc:creator: Noemie Bisserbe

item.title: Opinion | Why We Should Care About NATO’s Legacy
item.description: If President Trump truly wants to leave behind a legacy of peace, keeping the alliance intact would be a great way to start.

item.title: Opinion | Expose the Iran Money Trail
item.description: Putting U.S. financial institutions on notice that they may be processing illicit funds invites further scrutiny.

item.title: China Signals Tolerance for Stronger Yuan
item.description: The People’s Bank of China set the strongest reference rate for the currency in almost three years.
item.dc:creator: Hannah Miao

item.title: China Sees a Chance to Lure Jaded U.S. Allies
item.description: Beijing has seized upon the disarray within the trans-Atlantic alliance and is trying to entice U.S. allies with the promise of reliable trade partnerships.
item.dc:creator: Austin Ramzy

item.title: Several People Missing After Landslide Buries Campground in New Zealand
item.description: Debris engulfed the site at Mount Maunganui following record rainfall. A government minister said young people were among the missing.
item.dc:creator: Mike Cherney

item.title: Trump Wants Peace Board to Rewrite Global Order—but Major Powers Aren’t Sold
item.description: U.S. allies worry about joining an organization that could weaken the U.N. and give equal status to authoritarians such as Vladimir Putin.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Ward

item.title: Alarm Over Trump’s Greenland Threat Gives Way to Uncertainty Around Future Deal
item.description: There was little clarity about what would happen next after the president made an abrupt reversal in his push to take control of the Danish island.
item.dc:creator: Drew Hinshaw

item.title: The West Stepped Back From the Brink. But Europe’s Distrust of America Lingers.
item.description: Despite President Trump’s U-turn on using military force and tariffs to seize Greenland, America’s allies fear worse turbulence ahead.

item.title: Trump’s About-Face on Greenland Thrusts Europe Into Another Dilemma
item.description: After a tariff reprieve, European Union leaders must chart a new course for handling Washington.

item.title: Venezuela Unveils Oil Bill to Attract Investors, Lift Output
item.description: Oil analysts said the reform would help foreign companies already in Venezuela but falls short of President Trump’s plans to attract big investments.

item.title: The U.S. Is Actively Seeking Regime Change in Cuba by the End of the Year
item.description: After ousting Venezuela’s leader, the Trump administration is hunting for Havana insiders who could cut a deal to end Communist rule.

item.title: At NATO’s HQ, Military Chiefs Tune Out Battle Over Greenland
item.description: To be ready to “fight tonight,” top brass and other officials in the 32-country alliance said they must operate in an unusual bubble.

item.title: Forget Greenland. Macron’s Sunglasses Take Over Davos.
item.description: Not since Sarah Palin hit the stage in rimless glasses has a piece of eyewear created such a global stir. The story behind the French president’s shades.

item.title: U.S. Weighs Complete Military Withdrawal From Syria
item.description: The near collapse of the U.S.’s Kurdish allies has prompted the Pentagon to question the benefits of stationing troops in Syria.

item.title: Gilt Yields Rise, Sterling Falls as Political Uncertainty Resurfaces in U.K.
item.description: A local district election could usher in the return of Andy Burnham, reports suggested, providing a route back to parliament for the current mayor of Greater Manchester, seen as a figurehead for those on the left of the ruling Labour Party.
item.dc:creator: Renae Dyer

item.title: Trump Has Options in Iran. None Are Likely to Help Protesters Much.
item.description: A U.S. aircraft carrier is heading to the region. If Trump decides to intervene over Tehran’s crackdown, there could be unpredictable consequences.
item.dc:creator: Sune Engel Rasmussen

item.title: U.K. Government Borrowing Falls For Third Straight Month
item.description: The decline indicates the U.K. government has started to contain a rise in debts following a series of tax increases.

item.title: Europe’s Populists Embraced Trump. Now They Are Getting Buyer’s Remorse.

item.title: Trump Says Peace Board Promises Rosier Future for Middle East
item.description: The new board marks the first steps toward a end to conflict in the Middle East and the wider globe, Trump told world leaders gathered in Davos, Switzerland.

item.title: Asian Stocks, Bonds Recover as Fears About U.S. Tariffs on Europe Ease
item.description: Asian stocks and government bonds were mostly higher, after President Trump backed down on his threat of tariffs on European countries over their resistance to his Greenland plan.

item.title: In Ominous Sign for Regime, Iran’s Protests Began in Conservative Stronghold

item.title: The Chinese Spy Machine Infiltrating Taiwan’s Military
item.description: Beijing’s rapidly advancing spying operations have seen agents penetrate the island’s armed forces, enticing personnel to pledge allegiance to China.

item.title: South Korea Economy Weakened in 2025 as Tariffs Took a Toll
item.description: The South Korean economy was bruised by a year of tariffs and political turmoil that slowed annual growth to a five-year low.

item.title: Chevron’s Dilemma in Venezuela: Support Trump’s Vision Without Losing Money

item.title: China Imports to Help Lower U.K. Inflation to Target, BOE’s Taylor Says
item.description: The annual rate of inflation is likely to fall to the Bank of England’s 2% target by the middle of this year, aided by cheap imports from China, the rate-setter said.

item.title: A Custody Battle Over Dogs Rocks an African Nation

item.description: Audrey Truschke’s single-volume work makes a bold attempt to capture thousands of years of cultural ferment on the Indian subcontinent.
